bibl.title: The Conflict Reconsidered: Cleopatra and the Civil War in the Early Imperial Epic.
bibl.note: The fall of Egypt in the sources of the Augusta Era. The Civil War concealed. - The end of history? Actium in the continuum of the civil struggles. - Ne nostra quidem matrona. Epic Cleopatra's failure in the female role. - The threatening dux femina. - Epic Cleopatra and the foreshadowing of doom. - Sympathising the enemy. A humane epic outlook or a propagandistic tool? - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: Elina Pyy, The Conflict Reconsidered: Cleopatra and the Civil War in the Early Imperial Epic.

The fall of Egypt in the sources of the Augusta Era. The Civil War concealed. - The end of history? Actium in the continuum of the civil struggles. - Ne nostra quidem matrona. Epic Cleopatra's failure in the female role. - The threatening dux femina. - Epic Cleopatra and the foreshadowing of doom. - Sympathising the enemy. A humane epic outlook or a propagandistic tool? - Conclusion.
